      public TuitionController()

  • Method Details

    • uniqueStudent

      private Student uniqueStudent(String name, Major major, Roster rosterCollection)
      Searches the roster to find if a student exists or not.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the student.
      major - major of the student.
      rosterCollection - the student roster.
      Returns:
      the student if found, null otherwise.

    • getMajor

      private Major getMajor(javafx.scene.control.RadioButton majorButton)
      Gets the chosen major in the major toggle group.
      Parameters:
      majorButton - the chosen major.
      Returns:
      the major and Major type.

    • resetInputs

      private void resetInputs()
      Resets the options once Add, Remove, or Tuition due is pressed. Resets by unselecting and setting disables.

    • selectResident

      void selectResident(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Disables all non-resident related options when the resident radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • selectNonResident

      void selectNonResident(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Disables the resident radio button and extra options for tristate and international radio buttons. The extra options for tristate is the NY and CT radio buttons. The extra options for international is the study abroad checkbox.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • selectTristate

      void selectTristate(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Disables international extra options if tristate is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • selectInternational

      void selectInternational(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Disables tristate extra options if international is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • add

      void add(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Add button. Used to add a student.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • remove

      void remove(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Remove button. Used to remove a student.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • calculateTuition

      void calculateTuition(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Tuition Due button. Used to calculate a given student's tuition.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • paying

      void paying(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Pay button. Adds a payment to a certain student's tuition.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • setFinancial

      void setFinancial(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Set button. Sets a financial aid amount for a given Resident student.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • changeStudentStatus

      void changeStudentStatus(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Change Student to Studying Abroad button. Changes their status to studying abroad if they were International.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • processTuitions

      void processTuitions(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Process Roster Tuitions button. Process the tuitions for all students in the roster.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • printRoster

      void printRoster(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Print Roster Button. Prints all students in the roster in current order.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • printRosterByName

      void printRosterByName(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Print Roster By Name Button. Prints all students in the roster by name.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.

    • printStudentsWithPayment

      void printStudentsWithPayment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler for the Print Students With Payment button. Prints all students who have paid in order of payment date.
      Parameters:
      event - the action events.
